title: Discovery – Sentence Pattern A (Subject + Verb)
goals: Form and translate Subject + Verb sentences (Pattern A)
Review noun endings that mark the subject (nominative case)
Identify the verb’s person and number
Connect truthful words with truthful seeing (Veritas)

steps.speak: Salve! Welcome to Week 13 Day 1. We’ll learn how Latin joins nouns and verbs to tell true things.
Remember our noun endings – a and – us show who does the action (the subject).
Chant two examples: puella (puella, puellae) and puer (puer, puerī). They are nominative when they do the action.
Now pair them with verbs: Puella amat – The girl loves. Puer videt – The boy sees.
Ask: Which word is the subject? Which is the verb?
Excellent! Now say your own truthful sentence: Deus videt – God sees.
Let’s chant our verbs again: amō, amās, amat / videō, vidēs, videt. Notice the –t for ‘he/she’.
Mini quiz – Say a subject and verb together: Agricola portat … What does it mean?
Faith phrase: Verbum Dei verum est – The Word of God is true. Say it three times clearly.
Virtue connection: When we speak truthfully, we follow Veritas and honor God’s Word.
Great work! Tomorrow we add a direct object to our sentences.
